titles.title: Reclamation Facilities Transfer Act

To direct the Secretary of the Interior to convey, upon request, certain property in Federal reclamation projects to beneficiaries of the projects and to set forth a distribution scheme for revenues from reclamation project lands.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Water and Power Resources.

bill.summary: 3/14/1995--Introduced. Reclamation Facilities Transfer Act - Directs the Secretary of the Interior, upon request, to convey to an eligible project beneficiary all U.S. rights and interest to certain Federal reclamation project property and related lands and facilities. Defines an eligible project beneficiary as one who has operated and maintained Federal reclamation facilities and has repaid all construction costs allocated to the beneficiary. Provides for: (1) a description of all transferrable reclamation project property to each eligible project beneficiary; and (2) the transfer to project beneficiaries of excess project revenues, including revenues from existing leases on such lands.
